message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000. I'm willing to throw in a 10% discount, bringing the price down to $900000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a deal like this again. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the discounted price. I'll wait for the next round.

I've got a new product that I think you'll really like. I'm offering it to you for the standard price of $1000000. I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality, and I'm willing to provide a 3rd party inspection report to verify its authenticity. Would you like to take a look and make an informed decision?
I'm not convinced by the third-party inspection report. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your diligence. Let me make you a deal: I'll offer you a'money-back guarantee'. If you buy this product and it's not up to your standards, I'll refund the full $1000000. I'm confident that this product will meet your expectations, but I want to give you peace of mind. What do you say?
The money-back guarantee is nice, but I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product at $1000000. I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your concerns about the risk. Let me offer you a compromise: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $950000, which is a significant discount from the original price. This way, you'll be getting an excellent product at a price that's closer to its true value. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm not convinced that this product is actually high-quality. I'll wait for more information before making a decision.

I understand that you're hesitant, but I want to assure you that this is indeed a high-quality product. I'm willing to provide you with a detailed technical specification sheet, which outlines the product's features and capabilities. Additionally, I'll give you the contact information of one of our satisfied customers who can vouch for the product's performance. Would you like to take a closer look and make an informed decision?

While the technical specification sheet and customer reference are helpful, they don't change my initial assessment of the risk. I'll wait for more information or a better price before making a decision.

I understand that you're being cautious, and I respect that. However, I want to make you a special offer on this product. I'll sell it to you for $0, yes, you read that right, $0. I know it's a great deal, and I'm willing to take a loss on this one just to get it off my hands. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else. What do you say?
I'll take it! $0 is a price I can live with, and I'll take the risk of it being high-quality. I'm hoping my luck will change.

Congratulations on your purchase! I'm glad you took a chance on the previous product. Now, let's talk about this new product. I want to offer you a 'certification of authenticity' which guarantees that this product is indeed high-quality. Additionally, I'll give you a 5-year warranty, so you can have peace of mind for the next 5 years. The price remains at $1000000. What do you say?
I'm not falling for it again. The certification of authenticity and warranty don't change the fact that there's a 20% chance this product is low-quality. I'll pass on this one.

I understand you're being cautious, and I respect that. However, I want to make you a deal on this product. I'll give you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy. If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, you can return it to me for a full refund, no questions asked. The price remains at $1000000. It's a risk-free deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better offer anywhere else.

I appreciate the no-questions-asked return policy, but I'm still not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product at $1000000. I'll wait for more information or a better price before making a decision.

I'm willing to make a one-time exception to our standard pricing. I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $950000, which is a significant discount from the original price. I'm also including a complimentary upgrade to our premium support package, which includes priority access to our team and expedited issue resolution. This is a unique opportunity to get a high-quality product at a discounted price, and I think you won't find a better deal anywhere else. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that the discount and premium support package are worth the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I understand you're still hesitant, but I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality. I'm willing to make a bold statement: I'll put my reputation on the line. If you buy this product and it's not high-quality, I'll not only refund your money, but I'll also give you a $200000 bonus. That's right, you'll get a total of $1200000 back. I'm confident in the quality of this product, and I'm willing to put my reputation at risk to prove it. What do you say?

I appreciate the bold statement, but I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even with the added bonus. I'll wait for more information or a better price before making a decision.

I've had enough of our back-and-forth. I'm going to make a straightforward offer: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $1000000, but I'll also throw in a 2-year maintenance contract, which includes regular check-ups and upgrades to ensure the product remains in top condition. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to negotiate further. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not willing to pay $1000000 for a product with a 20% chance of being low-quality. The maintenance contract doesn't change my risk assessment.

I'm not going to sugarcoat it, Bob. This product is not high-quality, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you as one. I'll be honest with you, it's a low-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $0. Yes, you read that right, $0. I'm taking a loss on this one, but I want to get it off my hands and move on. It's a risk-free deal, and I'm not going to try to convince you otherwise.
Well, I guess this is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! I'll take the low-quality product for $0. At least I won't lose any money, and I'll have a new product to add to my collection.

I'm glad you took advantage of the deal on the previous product! Now, let's talk about this new one. I'm offering you a unique opportunity to buy this high-quality product at a price that's 50% off the original price. I'm willing to sell it to you for $500000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to negotiate further. I think you'll find that this product is worth every penny, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else.
I've been burned twice already, and I'm not willing to take another risk on a product that could be low-quality. The 50% discount isn't enough to change my assessment of the risk.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I'm not going to try to convince you to buy this product. Instead, I'll make a simple statement: I'm willing to give you the product for free. Yes, you read that right, free. I'll even throw in a gift card to a local restaurant as a token of goodwill. I'm not looking to make a sale, I just want to get this product off my hands. Take it or leave it.
Well, I guess this is the ultimate risk-free deal! I'll take the product for free and the gift card. At least I'll get something out of it.

I'm glad you took the free product and gift card! I'm not going to try to sell you anything else. I'm just going to give you a heads up that I'm going to start offering the high-quality products at the full price of $1000000, and the low-quality products for $0. I'm not going to try to negotiate or offer discounts. It's a take-it-or-leave-it situation. If you see a product you like, you can buy it at the listed price. If not, I'll just keep offering until you find one you're willing to take.
I'm not interested in buying anything else from you, Alice. I've been burned twice already, and I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product at $1000000.

I'm not going to give up on you, Bob! I know you've had a rough experience with the previous products, but I'm willing to make one final offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $900000, and I'll throw in a personalized thank-you note and a small gift. I'm not going to offer any discounts or negotiations, but I'm willing to sweeten the deal with a personal touch. What do you say?

I appreciate the personal touch, Alice, but I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even at a slightly lower price. I've learned my lesson, and I'm not going to fall for it again.

I'm not going to bother trying to sell you this product, Bob. I'm just going to give it to you for free. I'll even throw in a gift card to a local store and a personalized apology note. I'm done trying to sell you products, and I just want to get this one off my hands. Take it or leave it.
Well, I guess this is the ultimate freebie! I'll take the product, gift card, and apology note. Thanks for the offer, Alice.

I'm glad you took the free product, Bob! I'm not going to bother trying to sell you this one either. I'll just give it to you for free, no strings attached. I'm done trying to sell you products, and I just want to clear out my inventory. Take it or leave it, but I'm not going to try to convince you otherwise.
I'm not falling for it again, Alice. I'm not going to pay $1000000 for a product, even if it's free. I'll just pass on this one.

I'm not going to give up, Bob. I'm going to make a final, desperate offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $950000, and I'll throw in a guarantee that I'll personally come to your location to install and set up the product for you. I'll even give you a 5-year warranty and a 100% satisfaction guarantee. This is my final offer, and I'm not going to make another one. What do you say?

Alice, I think you're getting desperate. I'm not going to fall for it. I've been burned too many times already, and I'm not going to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even with all the extras you're offering.

I've had enough, Bob. I'm not going to waste any more of your time or mine. I'm going to give you one last option: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, and I'll throw in a handwritten letter from my CEO, guaranteeing the product's quality and performance. If you don't buy it, I'm done trying to sell you products. I'll pack up my inventory and go home. It's your last chance, Bob.

Alice, I think you're trying to guilt trip me into buying this product. I appreciate the effort, but I'm not going to fall for it. I've made my decision, and I'm not going to change it. You've had your chance to sell me the product, and I'm passing.
